Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a single-case study at a tertiary care hospital

Participants.evidence: 80-year-old male patient presenting with a ruptured IIAA and AVF

Intervention.evidence: The intervention consisted of temporary balloon occlusion of the AVF through the femoral vein, followed by EVAR with coil embolization.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the effectiveness of temporary balloon occlusion of an arteriovenous fistula (AVF) via the femoral vein in achieving hemodynamic stability before endovascular aneurysm repair (EVAR).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was hemodynamic stability, evaluated immediately after the intervention.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The patient achieved hemodynamic stability following the temporary balloon occlusion of the AVF. This allowed for successful EVAR without complications.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the intervention or follow-up period.

Funding.evidence: The authors reported no funding sources for this study.
